text: Charles Henry "Chuck" Noll (January 5, 1932 - June 13, 2014) was an American football player and coach in the National Football League (NFL). He played for Cleveland Browns from 1953 to 1959. He was the only head coach for the Pittsburgh Steelers from 1969 to 1991. He has more Super Bowl wins (4) than any other head coach in NFL history, and was elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 1993. Noll was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He went to the University of Dayton on a football scolarship. Noll died on June 13, 2014 in Sewickley, Pennsylvania, aged 82.
